summary: This bill, titled the "Capitol Remembrance Act," directs the Architect of the Capitol to create and install a permanent exhibit in the U.S. Capitol about the attack that occurred on January 6, 2021. The project, to be completed within two years, must be in a prominent location and include damaged property, photographs, and a plaque honoring the law enforcement officers who protected the Capitol, including those who died or were injured, as well as the staff who restored the building. The exhibit may also feature artwork. The act authorizes the necessary funds for its creation.
